isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3600, 3800, 4000FBC - LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Check fuse A1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move key switch to ignition position, and at A1 and circuit 13, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13, then repair.
Disconnect connector (2A) and turn key on. At (2) circuit 71, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71, then repair.
Disconnect back-up light switch (304) and reconnect conn. (2A). At (304) circuit 71, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71, then repair.
Test back-up light switch (304) by placing transmission in reverse, and measuring resistance from black wire to white wire.
Disconnect conn. (2A) and reconnect conn. (304). With transmission in reverse, at (2A) measure resistance from circuit 71 to 71A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 71A, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (2A) and disconnect body builder conn. (194). Turn key on and with transmission in reverse, measure voltage at (194) from circuit 71A to ground.
OEM back-up light circuits check good.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71A, then repair.

svcsubproc.title: Fog Light System With and Without Daytime Running Lights (DRL)

table.title: Fog Light System With and Without Daytime Running Lights (DRL)

entry.para: Remove fuse F3 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition and repair. Replace fuse.
Measure voltage at F3, circuit 14A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Remove fog light relay from connector socket (99). Measure voltage from circuit 64 to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 64 or conn. (115), then repair.
Measure voltage at conn. socket (99) from circuit 64 to 64-G.
Locate open or poor connection in ground circuit 64-G, then repair.
Disconnect fog light switch from conn. (98). With headlight switch in the on position, and the dimmer switch in low beam position, measure voltage from circuit 64A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 64A or conn. (115), then repair.
Measure voltage at conn. (98) from circuit 64A to 64-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in gnd. cir. 64-GA, then repair.
At connector socket (99), install jumper wire from circuit 64B to 64-G. Measure voltage at conn. (98) between 64A and 64B.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 64B and repair.
With fog light switch still removed, and in the on position, measure resistance across terminals which were connected to 64A and 64B.
With switch in the off position, measure resistance across terminals which were connected to 64A and 64B.
Re-install fog light switch and switch on. Does indicator light up?
Disconnect conn. (501). At relay socket (99) install test jumper from circuit 64 to 64C. At (501) relay side, measure voltage from 64C to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 64C, then repair.
Turn off fog light switch, remove jumper and re-install fog light relay. With fog light switch in off position, measure voltage from 64C to ground at conn. (501).
With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in the low beam position, turn fog light switch on. At conn. (501) measure voltage from 64C to gnd.
Reconnect conn. (501). Does left fog light work?
Disconnect conn. (506) and measure voltage from 64D to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 64D, then repair.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 64-GC/ 64-GB, conn. (501), circuit 64-GB/ 11-GB, conn. (425), or circuit 11-GB/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Disconnect connector (506) and if fog light does not function, replace lamp or fog light assembly.
Disconnect conn. (507) and measure voltage from 64E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 64E, then repair.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 64-GD/ 64-GB, conn. (501), circuit 64-GB/11-GB, conn. (425), or circuit 11-GB/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (507) and if fog light does not function, replace lamp or fog light assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuits With Tilt Steering Column and Without DRL

table.title: Headlight Circuits With Tilt Steering Column and Without DRL

entry.para: Disconnect conn. (60) and at circuit 50, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50, then repair.
At disconnected headlight switch (60), measure resistance from terminal that was connected to circuit 50 to terminal that was connected to circuit 51A (51 with 3600), with switch in on position.
Reconnect conn. (60) and disconnect conn. (191). Move headlight switch to on position and at (191) circuit 51A (51 with 3600), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51A or 51, then repair.
At dimmer switch, conn. (191), measure resistance from pin C to B with switch in low beam position.
At dimmer switch conn. (191), measure resistance from pin C to A with switch in high beam position.
Disconnect conn. (2) and reconnect conn. (191). With headlight sw. on and dimmer sw. in low beam position, at (2) circuit 53 [going to (191)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53/53B, then repair.
Move dimmer sw. to high beam position, and with headlight sw. on, at (2) circuit 52 [going to (191)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52/52D (52/52C w/3600), then repair.
Disconnect conn. (502) and (504) and reconnect conn. (2). With dimmer sw. in low beam position, and headlight sw. on, at (502) circuit 53B, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53, conn. (413) [conn. (526) w/3600], and cir. 53/53B, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504) circuit 53A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53A, then repair.
With switches still set, at (502), measure voltage from circuit 53B to 11-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GC/ 11-GB, conn. (425) [conn. (526) w/3600], circuit 11-GB/ 11-GJ (cir. 11-GG/ 11-GB/ 11-GJ w/3600), then repair.
With switches still set, at (504), measure voltage from circuit 53A to 11-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GE, then repair.
With dimmer switch in high beam position and headlight switch on, at (502) circuit 52C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52, conn. (413) [conn. (526) w/3600] or circuit 52/52C, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504) circuit 52B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52B, then repair.
Wiring to headlights checks good. If lamps fail to illuminate, replace defective bulbs.
With switches still set, does high beam indicator illuminate?
Disconnect cluster conn. (27) and at circuit 52A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52A, then repair.
With switches still set, at (27), measure voltage from circuit 52A to 28-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-GB/ 11-GB to gnd. (28-GB/ 11-GC w/3600), then repair.
Circuits to high beam indicator check good. If lamp fails to illuminate, replace lamp or socket.
Headlight circuits check good. Move headlight switch to off position and reconnect all disconnected connectors.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuits With Stationary Steering Column and Without DRL, 3800, 4700FBC, 4900FBC

table.title: Headlight Circuits With Stationary Steering Column and Without DRL, 3800, 4700FBC, 4900FBC

entry.para: Disconnect headlight conn. (60) and at circuit 50, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50, then repair.
With disconnected headlight switch in the on position, measure resistance from terminal that was connected to circuit 50 to terminal that was connected to circuit 51.
Remove lift-to-dim relay (100) and reconnect headlight switch (60). Move headlight switch to on position, and at relay socket (100) circuit 51, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51, then repair.
With headlight switch still on, at relay socket (100), measure voltage from circuit 51F to gnd. at end not connected to circuit 51.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51F, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (192) and at circuit 51-G, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51-G/11-G, then repair.
Test headlight dimmer switch by measuring resistance from pin C to B of conn. (192) that goes to switch, with the switch in the low beam/dim position.
Test headlight dimmer switch by measuring resistance from pin A to B of conn. (192) that goes to switch, with the switch held in the flash-to-pass position.
Reconnect conn. (192), place dimmer sw. in low beam/dim position, and at relay socket (100) circuit 51D, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51D, then repair.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (100) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (100) by applying +12V to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (100), disconnect conn. (2), move dimmer switch to low beam/dim position, and at circuit 53 [going to socket (100)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53/53A, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to high beam/ bright position, and at (2) circuit 52 [going to socket (100)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52C/52, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (502) and (504) and reconnect (2). With dimmer sw. in low beam/dim position, and headlight sw. on, at (502) circuit 53B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53, conn. (413), or circuit 53/53B, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504) circuit 53A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53A, then repair.
With switches still set, at (502), measure voltage from circuit 53B to 11-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GC/ 11-GB, conn. (425), or circuit 11-GB/ 11-GJ, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504), measure voltage from circuit 53A to 11-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GE, then repair.
With dimmer switch in high beam position and headlight switch on, at (502), circuit 52C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52, conn. (413) or circuit 52/52C, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504), circuit 52B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52B, then repair.
Wiring to headlights checks good. If lamps fail to illuminate, replace defective bulls
With switches still set, does high beam indicator illuminate?
Disconnect conn. (27) and at circuit 52A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52A, then repair.
With switches still set, at (27), measure voltage from circuit 52A to 28-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-GB/ 11-GB, then repair.
Circuits to high beam indicator check good. If lamp fails to illuminate, replace defective lamp or socket. Switch off headlight switch.
While holding dimmer switch in flash-to-pass position, do high beam/bright lights illuminate?
Check fuse D3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At D3 and circuit 14A, measure voltage to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Remove flash-to-pass relay (101) and measure voltage from circuit 50A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50A, then repair.
At relay socket (101), measure voltage from circuit 51C to ground at end not connected to circuit 50A.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51C, then repair.
While holding dimmer sw. in flash-to- pass position, at relay socket (101), measure resistance from circuit 51E to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51E, then repair.
Bench test flash-to- pass relay (101) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test flash-to- pass relay (101) by applying +12 V to pin 85, ground to 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install flash-to-pass relay (101) and hold dimmer sw. in flash-to- pass position. Do high beam/bright lights illuminate?
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52B/52, then repair.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuits With Tilt Steering Column and With DRL

table.title: Headlight Circuits With Tilt Steering Column and With DRL

entry.para: Disconnect conn. (60) and at circuit 50, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50, then repair.
At disconnected headlight switch (60), measure resistance from terminal that was connected to circuit 50 to terminal that was connected to circuit 51A (51 with 3600), with switch in on position.
Reconnect conn. (60) and disconnect conn. (191). Move headlight switch to on position and at (191) circuit 51A (51 w/3600), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51A or 51, then repair.
At dimmer switch conn. (191), measure resistance from pin C to B with switch in low beam position.
At dimmer switch conn. (191), measure resistance from pin C to A with switch in high beam position.
Disconnect conn. (2) and reconnect conn. (191). With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in low beam position, at (2) circuit 53 [going to (191)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53/53B, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to high beam position, and with headlight switch on, at (2) circuit 52 [going to (191)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52/52D (52/52C w/3600), then repair.
Disconnect conn. (502) and (504) and reconnect conn. (2). With dimmer switch in low beam position, and headlight switch on, at (502) circuit 53B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53, conn. (413) [conn. (526) with 3600], and circuit 53/53B, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504) circuit 53A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53A, then repair.
With switches still set, at (502), measure voltage from circuit 53B to 11-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GC/ 11-GB, conn. (425) [conn. (526) w/3600], circuit 11-GB/ 11-GJ (cir. 11-GG/ 11-GB/ 11-GJ w/3600), then repair.
With switches still set, at (505), measure voltage from circuit 53A to 11-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GE, then repair.
With dimmer switch in high beam position and headlight switch on, at (502) circuit 52C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52, conn. (413) [conn. (526) w/3600] or circuit 52/52C, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504) circuit 52B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52B, then repair.
Wiring to headlights checks good. If lamps fail to illuminate, replace defective bulbs.
With switches still set, does high beam indicator illuminate?
Disconnect cluster conn. (27) and at circuit 52A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52A, then repair.
With switches still set, at (27), measure voltage from circuit 52A to 28-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-GB/ 11-GB to gnd. (28-GB/ 11-GC, with 3600), then repair.
Circuits to high beam indicator check good. If lamp fails to illuminate, replace lamp or socket.
Remove fuse K1 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At K1 and circuit 66, measure voltage to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66, then repair.
Disconnect DRL module (165), and at circuit 66A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66A, then repair.
At conn. (165), measure voltage from circuit 66A to 66-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-GA, then repair.
Check fuse E1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse E1, move key switch to ignition position, and at fuse E1 and circuit 12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12, then repair.
Disconnect DRL conn. (165) and turn key on. At (165) circuit 66F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66F, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (115)/(115B) and measure resistance from (115B) circuit 64A to (165) circuit 64A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 64A, then repair.
With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in low beam/dim position, at (165) circuit 66C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66C or DRL connector (198), then repair.
With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in high beam/bright position, at (165) circuit 66E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66E or DRL connector (198), then repair.
With headlight switch off, reconnect conn. (165) and turn key switch on. Do headlights illuminate at approx. 60% brightness?
With switches still set, at conn. (115B) circuit 64A, measure voltage to ground.
Reconnect conn. (115). DRL circuits check good. Move headlight switch to off position.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuits With Stationary Steering Column and With DRL, 3800, 4700FBC, 4900FBC

table.title: Headlight Circuits With Stationary Steering Column and With DRL, 3800, 4700FBC, 4900FBC

entry.para: Disconnect headlight conn. (60) and at circuit 50, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50, then repair.
With disconnected headlight switch in the on position, measure resistance from terminal that was connected to circuit 50 to terminal that was connected to circuit 51.
Remove lift-to-dim relay (100) and reconnect headlight switch (60). Move headlight switch to on position, at relay socket (100) circuit 51, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51, then repair.
With headlight switch still on, at relay socket (100), measure voltage from circuit 51F to gnd. at end not connected to circuit.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51F, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (192) and at circuit 51-G, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51-G/11-G, then repair.
Test headlight dimmer switch by measuring resistance from pin C to B of conn. (192) that goes to switch, with the switch in the low beam/dim position.
Test headlight dimmer switch by measuring resistance from pin A to B of conn. (192) that goes to switch, with the switch held in the flash-to-pass position.
Reconnect conn. (192), place dimmer switch in low beam/dim position, and at relay socket (100) circuit 51D, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51D, then repair.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (100) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (100) by applying +12 V to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (100), disconnect conn. (2), move dimmer switch to low beam/dim position, and at circuit 53 [going to socket (100)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53/53A, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to high beam/bright position, and at (2) circuit 52 [going to socket (100)], measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52C/52, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (502) and (504) and reconnect (2). With dimmer switch in low beam/dim position, and headlight switch on, at (502) circuit 53B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53, conn. (413), or circuit 53/53B, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504) circuit 53A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53A, then repair.
With switches still set, at (502), measure voltage from circuit 53B to 11-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GC/ 11-GB, conn. (425), or circuit 11-GB/ 11-GJ, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504), measure voltage from circuit 53A to 11-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GE, then repair.
With dimmer switch in high beam position and headlight switch on, at (502) circuit 52C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52, conn. (413) or circuit 52/52C, then repair.
With switches still set, at (504) circuit 52B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52B, then repair.
Wiring to headlights checks good. If lamps fail to illuminate, replace defective bulbs.
With switches still set, does high beam indicator illuminate?
Disconnect conn. (27) and at circuit 52A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52A, then repair.
With switches still set, at (27), measure voltage from circuit 52A to 28-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-GB/ 11-GB, then repair.
Circuits to high beam indicator check good. If lamp fails to illuminate, replace defective lamp or socket. Switch off headlight switch.
While holding dimmer switch in flash-to-pass position, do high beam/bright lights illuminate?
Check fuse D3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At D3 and circuit 14A, measure voltage to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Remove flash-to-pass relay (101) and measure voltage from circuit 50A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50A, then repair.
At relay socket (101), measure voltage from circuit 51C to ground at end not connected to circuit 50A.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51C, then repair.
While holding dimmer switch in flash-to-pass position, at relay socket (101), measure resistance from circuit 51E to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51E, then repair.
Bench test flash-to- pass relay (101) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test flash-to- pass relay (101) by applying +12V to pin 85, ground to 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install flash-to-pass relay (101) and hold dimmer switch in flash-to-pass position. Do high beam/bright lights illuminate?
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52B/52, then repair.
Do DRL circuits function properly if so equipped?
Remove fuse K1 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At K1 and circuit 66, measure voltage to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66, then repair.
Disconnect DRL module (165), and at circuit 66A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66A, then repair.
At conn. (165), measure voltage from circuit 66A to 66-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-GA, then repair.
Check fuse E1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse E1, move key switch to ignition position, and at fuse E1 and circuit 12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12, then repair.
Disconnect DRL conn. (165) and turn key on. At (165) circuit 66F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66F, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (115)/(115B) and measure resistance from (115B) circuit 64A to (165) circuit 64A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 64A, then repair.
With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in low beam/dim position, at (165) circuit 66C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66C or DRL conn. (198), then repair.
With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in high beam/bright position, at (165) circuit 66E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66E or DRL connector (198), then repair.
With headlight switch off, reconnect conn. (165) and turn key switch on. Do headlights illuminate at approx. 60% brightness?
With switches still set, at conn. (115B) circuit 64A, measure voltage to ground.
Reconnect conn. (115). DRL circuits check good. Move headlight switch to off position.
Remove fuse E2 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse E2 and at E2 and circuit 14C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14C, then repair.
Disconnect headlight switch (60) and at (60) circuit 58, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58, then repair.
Test headlight switch (60) by measuring resistance from terminal 5 to 2 with switch on and rheostat adjusted to bright position.
Reconnect headlight switch (60), and with switch on and rheostat adjusted to bright position, at feed block (3M) circuit 62, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62, then repair.
With switch still on and rheostat set, at body builder conn. (194) and circuit 62F, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62F, then repair.
Disconnect left instrument cluster conn. (26), and with headlight switch (60) set, at (26) circuit 62A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62A, then repair.
With switch still set, at (26) measure voltage from circuit 62A to 62-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GA/ 11-GB, (62-GA/ 11-GC w/3600), then repair.
Circuits to left instrument cluster check good. Reconnect conn. (26) and replace lamp or defective socket of any light that fails to illuminate.
Disconnect center instrument cluster conn. (27) and with headlight switch (60) set, at (27) circuit 62B, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62B, then repair.
With switch still set, at (27) measure voltage from circuit 62B to 62-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GB/ 11-GB (62-GB/ 11-GC with 3600), then repair.
Circuits to center instrument cluster check good. Reconnect conn. (27) and replace lamp or defective socket of any light that fails to illuminate.
Disconnect right instrument cluster conn. (28), and with headlight switch (60) set, at (28) circuit 62C, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62C, then repair.
With switch still set, at (28), measure voltage from circuit 62C to 62-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GC/ 11-G, then repair.
Circuits to right instrument cluster check good. Reconnect conn. (28) and replace lamp or defective socket of any light that fails to illuminate.
Disconnect cruise control panel conn. (30). With headlight switch (60) set, at (30) circuit 62H, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62H, then repair.
With switch still set, at (30) measure voltage from circuit 62H to 62-GD.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GD/ 11-G, then repair.
Circuits to cruise control panel light check good. Reconnect conn. (30) and replace lamp or defective socket if it fails to illuminate.
For vehicles with auto. transmission panel lamp, disconnect unlabeled conn. (N/L) at lamp. With headlight switch (60) set, at (N/L) circuit 62E, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62E or conn. (N/L), then repair.
Circuits to auto. transmission panel lamp check good. Reconnect conn. (N/L) and replace defective lamp or socket if light fails to illuminate.
Disconnect ABS/Allison conn. (377), and with headlight switch (60) set, at (377) circuit 92A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 92A, conn. (219), or circuit 62E, then repair.
Panel light circuits check good. Move headlight switch to off, and reconnect conn. (377).
Remove fuse E2 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse E2 and at fuse E2, circuit 14C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14C, then repair.
Disconnect headlight switch conn. (60) and at circuit 58, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58, then repair.
With headlight switch in park light position, measure resistance across switch terminals 4 and 5.
Reconnect (60) and disconnect front end harness conn. (425) [conn. (526) w/3600]. With headlight sw. in park light position, at (425) or (526) circuit 58D, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58D, dash conn. (2), or circuit 58A, then repair.
At (425) or (526), measure resistance of circuit 11-GB or 11-GG to gnd.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 11-GB/ 11-GJ (11-GG/ 11-GB/ 11-GJ w/3600), then repair.
Disconnect left marker light conn. (503) and reconnect conn. (425)/(526). With headlight sw. in park light position, at (503) circuit 58E, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58E/58D, then repair.
With sw. still set, at (503) measure voltage from circuit 58E to 11-GD.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GD/ 11-GB, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (503). With headlight sw. in park light position, does left side marker light illuminate?
Disconnect left pedestal turn light conn. (508) and place headlight sw. in park light position. At (508) circuit 58H, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58H/58D, then repair.
With switch still set, at (508) measure voltage from circuit 58H to 11-GG.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GG/ 11-GB, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (508). With headlight sw. in park light position, does left dual face/ pedestal light illuminate?
Disconnect right pedestal turn light conn. (509) and place headlight switch in park light position. At (509) circuit 58J, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58J/58D, then repair.
With switch still set, at (509) measure voltage from circuit 58J to 11-GH.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GH/ 11-GB, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (509). With headlight sw. in park light position, does right dual face/ pedestal light illuminate?
Disconnect right marker light conn. (505) and place headlight sw. in park light position. At (505) circuit 58F, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58F/58D, then repair.
With switch still set, at (505) measure voltage from circuit 58F to 11-GF.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GF/ 11-GE/ 11-GB, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (505). With headlight sw. in park light position, does right marker light illuminate?
Park and marker light circuits check good.

svcsubproc.title: Stop Light Switch System - With Air Brakes

table.title: Stop Light Switch System With Air Brakes

entry.para: Check fuse D3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse D3, measure voltage from circuit 14A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Disconnect secondary stoplight sw. conn. (79) and ECM conn. (379). At (79) measure voltage from circuit 70C to ground with brakes applied.
Disconnect primary stoplight sw. conn. (80), and measure voltage from circuit 70B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit 70B, conn. (79) or circuit 70, then repair.
At switch (80), measure resistance across switch terminals with brakes applied.
At switch (80) red and brown leads, measure resistance from red wire to brown wire with brakes applied.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in cir. 70C, then repair.
Locate open or poor connection in red or brown wires, then repair.
At secondary stoplight sw. (79), measure resistance across sw. terminals with brakes applied.
At switch (79) red and brown leads, measure resistance from red wire to brown wire with brakes applied.
Locate open or poor connection in red or brown wires, then repair.
Reconnect stoplight sw. connector(s) and disconnect body builder conn. (194). At (194), measure voltage from circuit 70A to ground with brakes applied.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70A/70E, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (194). AT ECM (379), measure voltage from circuit 97N cavity 43 to ground with brakes applied.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97N, bulkhead conn. (3) or circuit 97N/70E, then repair.
At ECM (379), measure voltage from circuit 97M cavity 44 to ground with brakes applied.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97M, bulkhead conn. (3) or circuit 97M, then repair.
Stoplight switch circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for troubleshooting the ECM.

svcsubproc.title: Stop Light Switch System - With Hydraulic Brakes

table.title: Stop Light Switch System With Hydraulic Brakes

entry.para: Check fuse D3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse D3, measure voltage from circuit 14A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Disconnect stoplight sw. conn. (51), and measure voltage from circuit 70 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70, then repair.
At switch (51), measure resistance across switch terminals with brakes applied.
Reconnect (51) and disconnect brake monitor module conn. (49), ECM conn. (379), and body builder conn. (194).
At (194), measure voltage from circuit 70A to ground with brakes applied.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70A/70C, then repair.
At ECM (379), measure voltage from circuit 97N, cavity 43, to ground with brakes applied.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97/70C, then repair.
At brake monitor module conn. (49), measure voltage from circuit 90R to ground with brakes applied.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90R/70C, then repair.
Reconnect connectors. Stoplight switch circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for troubleshooting the ECM.
